terms.kana: ぜんもんのとらこうもんのおおかみ
terms.romaji: zenmon no tora koumon no ookami
translation: Out of the frying pan and into the fire
to escape one danger and encounter another
terms.literal translation: Tiger at the front gate, wolf at the rear gate
terms.note: It may be tempting to translate this as "Between a rock and a hard place," but from what I've seen the above translations are more accurate.
"Cool your head!" has an almost identical meaning in English. Interesting that an idiomatic phrase like this can be translated directly.

terms.translation: Add interjections to show that one is paying attention
terms.example: A: "Blah blah blah blah" B: 「なるほど」

terms.source phrase: 何を言ってやがるんだ

terms.kana: じゃくにくきょうしょく

terms.description: Based on 歌舞伎十八番 (Kabuki Juuhachiban), 18 Kabuki performances selected by Ichikawa Danjuurou VII

terms.term: 背に腹は代えられない
terms.kana: せにはらはかえられない
translation: Can't make an omelette without breaking a few eggs
Can't solve a problem without making a sacrifice
terms.literal translation: The back cannot replace the abdomen
terms.explanation: The abdomen is more vital, so one must sacrifice the back to avoid greater injury

terms.kana: ふこうちゅうのさいわい
